ISY Class¶

  • Node Manager Library
    • Node Manager
    • Node
class PyISY.ISY(address, port, username, password, use_https=False, log=None)[source]¶

This is the main class that handles interaction with the ISY device.

address: String of the IP address of the ISY device
port: String of the port over which the ISY is serving its API
username: String of the administrator username for the ISY
password: String of the administrator password for the ISY
use_https: [optional] Boolean of whether secured HTTP should be used
log: [optional] Log file class from logging module
__del__()[source]¶

Turns off auto updating when the class is deleted.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

auto_reconnect = True¶

Boolean value that indicates if the class should auto-reconnect to the event stream if the connection is lost.

auto_update¶

Boolean value that controls the class’s subscription to the event stream that allows node, program, and climate values to be updated automatically.

climate = None¶

Climate manager that holds all climate properties from the controller if the climate module is installed on the controller.

connected¶

Read only boolean value indicating if the class is connected to the controller.

log = None¶

Logger used by the class and its children.

nodes = None¶

Node manager that interacts with Insteon nodes and scenes (groups).

programs = None¶

Program manager that interacts with ISY programs and folders.

sendX10(address, cmd)[source]¶

Sends an X10 command.

address: String of X10 device address (Ex: A10) cmd: String of command to execute. Any key of x10_commands can be used

variables = None¶

Variable manager that interacts with ISY variables.

x10_commands = {'dim': 15, 'all_off': 1, 'on': 3, 'off': 11, 'bright': 7, 'all_on': 4}¶

Dictionary of X10 commands.
